c74object.name: fl.constant~
c74object.description: Output is a single value. The constant can be multiplied before output as set by the multiplier parameter.

entry.name: /constant [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the constant to output.
[0] - pi [1] - 1/pi [2] - e [3] - 1/e [4] - sqrt2 [5] - 1/sqrt2 [6] - epsilon

objarg.name: constant
objarg.description:
This argument sets the constant parameter:
Sets the constant to output.

objarg.name: multiplier
objarg.description:
This argument sets the multiplier parameter:
Sets the multiplier.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.constant~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.constant~. When set to 0 fl.constant~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.constant~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
